channel.title: Stephen Harper

item.title: Posted on Twitter
item.description: Canada will provide $45 million to support humanitarian organizations helping Syrians affected by this conflict. http://t.co/F1tiaMg8nX #g20

item.title: Posted on Twitter
item.description: The Gov't of Canada stands with the people of Syria as they continue to face unfathomable hardships at the hands of the Assad regime. #G20

item.title: Mentioned by Kamloops Daily News
item.description:
MP applauds tougher penalties for sex offenders
Tougher laws against child sex offenders, announced Thursday by Prime Minister Stephen Harper, are popularly supported, MP Cathy McLeod said on Thursday. Child sex offenders, particularly those who victimize multiple kids, could spend longer in prison ...

item.title: Mentioned by International Business Times AU
item.description:
Justin Trudeau Showed Poor Judgment: Canada PM
Prime Minister Stephen Harper criticised MP Justin Trudeau for unveiling the party policies on marijuana. He said that it "poor judgment" on Mr Trudeau's part. View Full Image. YouTube/Pollock And Pollock Ne Justin Trudeau fights for the legalization of ...

item.title: Mentioned by CTV News Barrie
item.description:
MP Kellie Leitch named to cabinet position
Prime Minister Stephen Harper appointed MP Dr. Kellie Leitch to her first cabinet position this morning. Harper named Leitch Minister of Labour and Minister of the Status of Women. Leitch was elected MP in Simcoe-Grey in 2011. Leitch replaces Rona ...

item.title: Mentioned by Canada.com
item.description:
ALERT – Vic Toews resigns as minister and MP
Toews's not-unexpected-resignation as a minister and Member of Parliament, effective Tuesday, came amid anticipation about a major cabinet shuffle by Prime Minister Stephen Harper. “The time has come to step aside and begin the next chapter of my life,” ...

item.title: Mentioned by Windsor Star
item.description:
Stephen Harper needs a good plan to soothe his restive backbench
Prime Minister Stephen Harper and Roberval-Lac-Saint-Jean MP Denis Lebel (left) cut a cake during St-Jean-Baptiste celebrations in Dolbeau-Mistassini, Que. on Monday June 24, 2013. THE CANADIAN PRESS/Gimmy Desbiens. Share. Comments Email.

item.description:
